intro: Hibbertia acicularis var. triandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It is an erect shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, producing small, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
